grammarModel.structure

Interface ISyntacticLeaf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ISyntacticStructure
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlternationRulE, ArithSeQ, BouncingCyclE, CenteR, CyclE, DigiT, EnumeratioN, EveryXEleM, FirstValuE, IncremenT, NoAlterN, PositioN, ReflectedParT, RelatioN, SizE, StartAT, SymmetrY, SymmetryWithCenteR, SyntacticLeaf, ValuE

    public interface ISyntacticLeaf
extends ISyntacticStructure
    ISyntacticLeaf is a terminal syntactic structure, representing the terminal node of a syntax tree. It has no component and is only characterized by its name and ID.
    Author:
    Gael Tregouet

    • Method Detail

      • getPosetElementName

        java.lang.String getPosetElementName()
                              throws GrammarModelException
        Description copied from interface: ISyntacticStructure
        A 'poset element name' is used to generate the property poset spanning chains from the syntactic structure, and ultimately the property poset itself. It is a concatenation of the syntactic element 'name' with an index generated to assure that that structures belonging to the same 'syntactic glove' can't return the same 'poset element name' if they don't have the same components. Put another way : two nodes from syntax trees belonging to the same glove (and possibly having the same name) can't generate the same 'poset element name' if they don't also generate the same derivation.
        Specified by:
        getPosetElementName in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        a 'poset element name'.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException
        See Also:
        IPosetMaxChains, IOriginalPropertyPoset

      • getListOfComponents

        java.util.List<ISyntacticStructure> getListOfComponents()
        Specified by:
        getListOfComponents in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        the list of component structures. The composition relationship between ISyntacticStructure objects being an equivalent to the derivation relationship between nodes of a syntax tree, component structures represent the nodes of a syntax tree that are directly derived from the generating node of this structure (the one that gives this structure its name).

      • getListOfSyntacticStringChains

        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getListOfSyntacticStringChains()
        Specified by:
        getListOfSyntacticStringChains in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        a list of lists of strings, representing all the spanning paths of the syntactic structure (leading from its generating node to one of its terminals).

      • getListOfPosetMaxStringChains

        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getListOfPosetMaxStringChains()
                                                                        throws GrammarModelException
        Specified by:
        getListOfPosetMaxStringChains in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        a list of lists of strings, representing the set of spanning chains of the poset (lower semilattice) that can be derived from this syntactic structure.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException

      • getLeafID

        long getLeafID()
        Returns:
        the ID long value that characterizes every terminal ('leaf') element.

      • getListOfLeafIDs

        java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getListOfLeafIDs()
        Specified by:
        getListOfLeafIDs in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        the list of IDs associated with every syntax leaf that can be derived from this structure's generating node. (All syntax leaves have a leafID).

      • getStringOfTerminals

        java.lang.String getStringOfTerminals()
        Specified by:
        getStringOfTerminals in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        a concatenation (with a separator) of the chain of syntax leaves (or terminals) that can be derived from this structure's generating node. If the node is itself a terminal (because the structure is a syntax leaf), its name is returned.

      • getIDHasBeenSet

        boolean getIDHasBeenSet()
        Specified by:
        getIDHasBeenSet in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        true, since the poset element ID of a syntax leaf is set by its constructor.

      • setPosetElementID

        void setPosetElementID(java.util.Map<ISyntacticChains,java.lang.String> chainsToIndex)
        The poset element ID of a syntax leaf is set by its constructor ; so this inherited method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        setPosetElementID in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Parameters:
        chainsToIndex - a map that associates tree paths with a unique ID.
        See Also:

      • replaceComponents

        boolean replaceComponents(ISyntacticStructure newComp,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Long> compID)
        This inherited method is irrelevant for a syntax leaf, since it has no component. Has no reason to be called, but if so, does not cause any error.
        Specified by:
        replaceComponents in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Parameters:
        newComp - new syntactic component
        compID - IDs of the leaves to be replaced
        Returns:
        true if a replacement has occurred.
